variants.Description in input context: A missense mutation in the SNCA gene (c.150G>A, p.G50E) associated with Parkinson's disease.
Another missense mutation in the SNCA gene (c.207G>A, p.G69E) linked to Lewy body dementia.

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's disease patients
Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's disease patients and healthy controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased α-synuclein aggregation was observed in brain tissue with the c.150G>A variant compared to controls.
Enhanced α-synuclein oligomerization was detected in brain tissue with the c.207G>A variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Five biological replicates were analyzed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were mentioned in the study.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare mutant and control groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein oligomerization levels below 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein oligomerization levels exceeding 30% of wild-type levels.
